availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Fossett (Pendleton County, KY, farmer and laborer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Ohio native. Married to Emily Eades Fossett in Pendleton County in March 1839. Father of Mary F. Fossett, Margaret Fossett, Eliza M. Fossett, Rebecca Fossett, Charlotte Fossett, Permelia D. Fossett, Bill Fossett, and Daniel L. Fossett. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Employed George Mitcher and Anthony Cavender as laborers in Pendleton County in 1850. Day laborer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 380B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 620.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 450B-451A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1827-1847, Film #000272805, p. 151 of 475 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
